alert.note: Alert for Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Harlan, southwestern Letcher and southeastern Perry Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 115 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Slemp, or 12 miles south of Hazard, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ulvah and Bluefield around 120 PM EDT. Banks, Hallie, Red Star, Gordon and Elko around 125 PM EDT. Letcher, Blackey, Skyline, Defeated Creek, Lilley Cornett Woods, Roxana, Kingdom Come S.P. and Indian Bottom around 130 PM EDT. Cumberland, Lynch, Flint, Kings Creek, Linefork, Oscaloosa, Blair, Premium and Hot Spot around 135 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Maggard, Partridge, Lewis Creek, Ice, Trailer, Whitco, Crown, Whitesburg, Day, Dongola, Marlowe and Bellcraft. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
